name: 俞齊山
objective: The aims of the course are to make students understanding the backgrounds, developments, as well as the architectures of the most widely used Intel’s microprocessors. By this course, students can also understand the concepts of memory interface, bus interface, interrupt I/O, and DMA I/O.
schedule:
Part I: Introduction to the microprocessors (4 wk)
Ch1. Introduction to the microprocessor and computer
Ch2. The microprocessor and its architecture
Ch3. The 80x86 addressing

Part II: 8086/8088 Hardware/Interfaces (9 wks)
Ch9. 8086/8088 Hardware specifications
Ch10. Memory interface
Ch11. Basic I/O interface
Ch12. Interrupts
Ch13. Direct memory access and DMA-controlled I/O
Ch14. The arithmetic coprocessor, MMX, and SIMD techniques
Ch15. Bus interface

Part III: Intel’s microprocessors (3 wks)
Ch16. The 80186, 80188, and 80286 microprocessors
Ch17. The 80386 and 80486 microprocessors
Ch18. The Pentium and Pentium pro microprocessors
scorePolicy: 1/3: midterm, 1/3: Final exam, 1/3: Home works, Quiz, and Attendances.
materials:
1.　　MASM使用說明(含MASM程式)
2.　　Data books of Intel’s CPUs
